page.title: 17An Oak Tree in Mortimer
page.content: On June 3rd, a fine oak tree in Victoria Road was felled, on land be- longing to an old family business, now sold for development (office block and two houses).We found people in street, bakery and library very eager to express their indignation:-{Old Age {Pensioner:}That was the meeting place for all us nippers. When they cut that down they cut off part of Mortimer. {Young Parents (ecologists):}Living green filling the sky, A friend in the village, suddenly torn out with no warning leaving an aching gap.{Member {of history group:}Just a memory left of a regrettable slaughter; many happy hours spent sitting in its shade with friends and visitors, talking old times and new.{Young parent/neighbour: Even a Preservation Order placed on this tree, an old friend, could not save it. Apparently it{had}to go.
